alert.note: Alert for Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 01 at 2:43PM EDT until October 03 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following areas, Coastal Indian River, Coastal Martin, Coastal Saint Lucie, Inland Indian River, Inland Martin, Inland Northern Brevard, Inland Saint Lucie, Inland Southern Brevard, Mainland Northern Brevard, Mainland Southern Brevard, Northern Brevard Barrier Islands and Southern Brevard Barrier Islands. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Extensive street flooding is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Persistent bands of heavier showers or storms will be capable of producing rainfall of 2 to 4 inches in a short period of time, with localized amounts up to 6+ inches possible, primarily across Indian River, St. Lucie and Martin counties through this evening. However, any additional rainfall across Brevard County will only worsen ongoing flooding issues that developed from heavy rainfall earlier today. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland St. Lucie
